intro: Clethra salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran clethra, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially sunny environments. Clethra salvadorensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
